row.col: This article documents a current sports-related event. Information may change as the event progresses.

image.caption: Geographical distribution of Serie B teams for season 2008-09

bdy.p:
The 2008–
09
Serie B
season will be the seventy-seventh since its establishment. 22 teams will contest the league, 15 of which will have contested in the
2007-08 season
, 4 of which will have been promoted from the
Serie C1
, and three relegated from the
Serie A .

sec.p: A total of 22 teams are competing in the Serie B 2008–09. This list include three teams relegated from Serie A and four teams promoted from Serie C1.

Noted teams featured in the league include
Parma F.C.
, who last played Serie B in 1989–90, winning their first promotion in the top flight under coach
Nevio Scala
and then going on to win two
UEFA Cup s, a European Super Cup, three
Coppa Italia , a
UEFA Cup Winners' Cup
and an Italian Super Cup before their relegation in 2007–08.

U.S. Sassuolo Calcio
, promoted to Serie B as Serie C1/A champions, are instead competing in the league for a historical first time. A vacancy created by the dismal of Sicilians
F.C. Messina Peloro was filled by the federation by including
U.S. Avellino
back in the league as the best team being relegated in 2007–08.

stadium.link: Stadio Cino e Lillo Del Duca

sec.p:
1Until their home stadium,
Stadio Pier Cesare Tombolato , is renovated.

Following the end of the 2007–08 season, rumours spread out regarding
Messina 's financial struggles which might lead the team to insolvency and following exclusion from the Serie B teamlist. This was implicitly confirmed by the fact that Messina has not organized a pre-season camp as of July 10, and the team being still without a coach. On July 14, 2008 the club board announced their intention to resign from the Serie B due to financial difficulties, also stating their intention to start again from amateur league
Serie D
.1

On July 25, 2008 the Italian Football Federation confirmed that Avellino had been readmitted to
Serie B
to replace Messina.23

row.col:
Qualification to
Serie A
promotion playoffs
Relegation to Lega Pro Prima Divisione
